puppeteer.description: Browser automation server for UI testing, accessibility checks, and visual verification
capabilities: Navigate to URLs and interact with pages
Test accessibility (ARIA, keyboard navigation, screen readers)
Run E2E tests (clicks, forms, user flows)
notes: Requires Node.js and npm to be installed
Chrome/Chromium will be downloaded automatically by Puppeteer if not present
Runs in headless mode by default for faster, safer execution
Can be configured to show browser window for debugging

metadata.description: MCP configuration for Learn Claude Code plugin - enables browser automation for UI testing
setup_instructions: 1. Ensure Node.js and npm are installed
3. Puppeteer will download Chrome/Chromium on first use
4. Test connection: ui-tester subagent should be able to launch browser

troubleshooting.chrome_not_found: Puppeteer will download Chrome automatically. If issues persist, install Chrome manually.
troubleshooting.permission_denied: Ensure Node.js and npm have proper permissions. May need to run with appropriate user privileges.
troubleshooting.slow_first_run: First run downloads packages and Chrome, which can take 1-2 minutes. Subsequent runs are fast.
troubleshooting.connection_failed: Check that no firewall is blocking localhost connections. Puppeteer needs local network access.

use_cases: Test UI components in real browser
Take screenshots for visual regression testing
Run E2E tests for user workflows
Check responsive design at different viewport sizes
Measure page performance and load times
